  • Method Details

    • of

      public static u.OptionalInt of(boolean[] a, boolean valueToFind)
      Returns the index of the specified value in the array.
      Parameters:
      a -
      valueToFind -
      Returns:
      An OptionalInt containing the index of the value in the array, or an empty OptionalInt if the value is not found.
      See Also:
      • of(Object[], Object)

    • ofSubArray

      public static u.OptionalInt ofSubArray(boolean[] sourceArray, int fromIndex, boolean[] subArrayToFind, int startIndexOfSubArray, int sizeToMatch) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the index of the specified sub-array in the given source array, starting from the specified index. The search starts at the specified fromIndex and checks for the sub-array starting from startIndexOfSubArray up to sizeToMatch elements.
      Parameters:
      sourceArray - The array to be searched.
      fromIndex - The index to start the search from.
      subArrayToFind - The sub-array to find in the source array.
      startIndexOfSubArray - The starting index of the sub-array to be found.
      sizeToMatch - The number of elements to match from the sub-array.
      Returns:
      An OptionalInt containing the index of the sub-array in the source array, or an empty OptionalInt if the sub-array is not found.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if startIndexOfSubArray and sizeToMatch do not denote a valid range in subArrayToFind.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        #ofSubArray(Object[], Object[], int, int, int)
      • String.indexOf(String)
      • String.indexOf(String, int)

    • ofSubArray

      An OptionalInt containing the index of the sub-array in the source array, or an empty OptionalInt if the sub-array is not found.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if startIndexOfSubArray and sizeToMatch do not denote a valid range in subArrayToFind.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        #ofSubArray(Object[], Object[], int, int, int)
      • String.indexOf(String)
      • String.indexOf(String, int)

    • ofSubArray

      public static u.OptionalInt ofSubArray(float[] sourceArray, int fromIndex, float[] subArrayToFind, int startIndexOfSubArray, int sizeToMatch) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the index of the specified sub-array in the given source array, starting from the specified index. The search starts at the specified fromIndex and checks for the sub-array starting from startIndexOfSubArray up to sizeToMatch elements.
      Parameters:
      sourceArray - The array to be searched.
      fromIndex - The index to start the search from.
      subArrayToFind - The sub-array to find in the source array.
      startIndexOfSubArray - The starting index of the sub-array to be found.
      sizeToMatch - The number of elements to match from the sub-array.
      Returns:
      An OptionalInt containing the index of the sub-array in the source array, or an empty OptionalInt if the sub-array is not found.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if startIndexOfSubArray and sizeToMatch do not denote a valid range in subArrayToFind.
      See Also:
      • invalid reference 
        #ofSubArray(Object[], Object[], int, int, int)
      • String.indexOf(String)
      • String.indexOf(String, int)

      Returns the last index of the specified sub-array in the given source array, starting from the specified index from the end.

    • lastOfSubArray

      public static u.OptionalInt lastOfSubArray(char[] sourceArray, int startIndexFromBack, char[] subArrayToFind, int startIndexOfSubArray, int sizeToMatch) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the last index of the specified sub-array in the given source array, starting from the specified index from the end. The search starts at the specified startIndexFromBack and checks for the sub-array starting from startIndexOfSubArray up to sizeToMatch elements.
      Parameters:
      sourceArray - The array to be searched.
      startIndexFromBack - The index to start the search from the end of the array.
      subArrayToFind - The sub-array to find in the source array.
      startIndexOfSubArray - The starting index of the sub-array to be found.
      sizeToMatch - The number of elements to match from the sub-array.
      Returns:
      An OptionalInt containing the last index of the sub-array in the source array, or an empty OptionalInt if the sub-array is not found.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if startIndexOfSubArray and sizeToMatch do not denote a valid range in subArrayToFind.
      See Also:
      • lastOfSubArray(Object[], int, Object[], int, int)
      • invalid reference 
        String#lastIndexOf(String, String)
      • invalid reference 
        String#lastIndexOf(String, String, int)

    • allOf

      public static BitSet allOf(boolean[] a, boolean valueToFind)
      Finds and returns the indices of all occurrences of the specified value in the given array.
      Parameters:
      a - The array to be searched.
      valueToFind - The value to find in the array.
      Returns:
      A BitSet containing the indices of all occurrences of the value in the array, or an empty BitSet if the value is not found or the input array is null.
      See Also:
      • allOf(Object[], Object)

    • allOf

      public static BitSet allOf(boolean[] a, boolean valueToFind, int fromIndex)
      Finds and returns the indices of all occurrences of the specified value in the given array, starting from the specified index.
      Parameters:
      a - The array to be searched.
      valueToFind - The value to find in the array.
      fromIndex - The index to start the search from.
      Returns:
      A BitSet containing the indices of all occurrences of the value in the array, or an empty BitSet if the value is not found or the input array is null.
      See Also:
      • allOf(Object[], Object, int)

      A BitSet containing the indices of all occurrences of the value in the array, or an empty BitSet if the value is not found or the input array is null.
      See Also:
      • allOf(Object[], Object, int)

    • allOf

      public static BitSet allOf(double[] a, double valueToFind, double tolerance)
      Finds and returns the indices of all occurrences of the specified value in the given array within a specified tolerance.
      Parameters:
      a - The array to be searched.
      valueToFind - The value to find in the array.
      tolerance - The tolerance within which matches will be found.
      Returns:
      A BitSet containing the indices of all occurrences of the value in the array within the specified tolerance, or an empty BitSet if the value is not found or the input array is null.

    • allOf

      public static <T> BitSet allOf(T[] a, Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Finds and returns the indices of all occurrences in the given array for which the provided predicate returns true.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      a - The array to be searched.
      predicate - The predicate to use to test the elements of the array.
      Returns:
      A BitSet containing the indices of all elements in the array for which the predicate returns true, or an empty BitSet if no elements match or the input array is null.

    • allOf

      public static <T> BitSet allOf(T[] a, Predicate<? super T> predicate, int fromIndex)
      Finds and returns the indices of all occurrences in the given array for which the provided predicate returns true, starting from the specified index.
      Type Parameters:

      predicate - The predicate to use to test the elements of the array.

      Returns:
      A BitSet containing the indices of all elements in the array for which the predicate returns true starting from the specified index, or an empty BitSet if no elements match or the input array is null.
